content: How many types of information can an ODT file hold?

According to the provided documents, an ODT file can hold encapsulated geological information such as Gas data, descriptions, lithology, % lithology, table/curve parameter details and qualitative information.
Which type of content can be viewed from an ODT file?

According to the Documents section, an ODT file contains:

1. Library information (headers, lithology, modifiers, structures, and symbols)
2. View file contents (track layout information, depth and screen units, scale and pen information)
3. ini file settings (curve defaults, computed curves and table definitions)

Therefore, an ODT file can be viewed as containing all of these types of content.
List the library informations from an ODT file

Based on the provided documents, to list library information from an ODT file, you can:

1. Open the template by selecting "Templat" on the GEOMenu.
2. In the Open Template dialog box, browse to the location of your ODT file and select it.
3. Click "Open".

The document information tree will be displayed, showing warnings if some components are not functioning correctly or have settings that are deemed not best practice.
Can an ODT be created from an existing ODF file?

Yes, an ODT (OpenDocument Template) can be created from an existing ODF (OpenDocument Format) file by selecting "Save as" and then choosing the template option. Alternatively, you can also create a new ODT directly from an ODF using the "Create Template" function in the GEO menu.
